   A language model is a type of artificial intelligence (AI) that understands and generates human language. It can read text, understand its meaning, and produce responses that sound natural to humans.

2. **What Does "Large" Mean?**  
   "Large" refers to the size of the model in terms of the number of parameters it has. Parameters are the internal variables the model uses to make predictions. A large language model has billions of these parameters, which allows it to understand and generate highly complex and nuanced text.

   Large language models are trained on vast amounts of text from the internet, books, articles, and other written sources. During training, the model learns patterns in language, such as grammar, vocabulary, and how sentences are structured.
